Wisdom: أَدِمْ ذِكْرَ الْمَوْتِ وَذِكْرَ مَا تَقَدَّمَ عَلَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ وَلَا تَتَمَنَّ الْمَوْتَ إِلَّا بِشَرْطٍ وَثِيقٍ
enWisdom: Continuously remember death and remember what you will face after death; and never wish for death except after being sure that you have fulfilled the condition for security [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: أَكْثِرْ ذِكْرَ الْمَوْتِ [اذْكُرِ الْمَوْتَ‏] وَمَا تَهْجُمُ عَلَيْهِ وَتُفْضِي إِلَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ حَتَّى يَأْتِيَكَ وَقَدْ أَخَذْتَ لَهُ حِذْرَكَ وَشَدَدْتَ لَهُ أَزْرَكَ وَلَا يَأْتِيكَ بَغْتَةً فَيَبْهَرَكَ
enWisdom: Increase your remembrance of death and of the place you have to go suddenly and return to after death, until it comes to you while you are on your guard against it and have prepared yourself for it, and let it not come over you suddenly thereby taking you by surprise

Wisdom: ذِكْرُ الْمَوْتِ يُهَوِّنُ أَسْبَابَ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Remembrance of death makes the means [and comforts] of this world seem trivial

Wisdom: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ذِكْرِ الْمَوْتِ نَجَا مِنْ خِدَاعِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: One who frequently remembers death is saved from the deceptions of this world

Wisdom: مَنْ ذَكَرَ الْمَوْتَ رَضِيَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بِالْيَسِيرِ
enWisdom: Whoever frequently remembers death is satisfied with the little he possesses of this world

Wisdom: اذْكُرُوا هَادِمَ اللَّذَّاتِ وَمُنَغِّصَ الشَّهَوَاتِ وَدَاعِيَ الشَّتَاتِ
enWisdom: Remember the destroyer of pleasures and the spoiler of lustful desires and the caller towards separation

Wisdom: أَلَا مُنْتَبِهٌ مِنْ رَقْدَتِهِ قَبْلَ حِينِ مَنِيَّتِهِ
enWisdom: Is there no one who will wake from his slumber before the time of his death?!

Wisdom: أَبْلَغُ الْعِظَاتِ النَّظَرُ إِلَى مَصَارِعِ الْأَمْوَاتِ وَالِاعْتِبَارُ بِمَصَايِرِ الْآبَاءِ وَالْأُمَّهَاتِ
enWisdom: The most effective admonition is looking at the places where the dead lay, and taking a lesson from the outcome of one’s forefathers and foremothers

Wisdom: إِنَّ وَرَاءَكَ طَالِباً حَثِيثاً مِنَ الْمَوْتِ فَلَا تَغْفُلْ
enWisdom: Verily behind you is a swift seeker in the form of death, so do not be negligent

Wisdom: إِذَا كَثُرَ النَّاعِي إِلَيْكَ قَامَ النَّاعِي بِكَ
enWisdom: When the bringer of the news of death comes frequently to you, he will [soon also] announce your death to others

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ بَادَرَ أَجَلَهُ وَأَخْلَصَ عَمَلَهُ
enWisdom: Blessed is one who anticipates his death and makes his actions sincere

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ نَسِيَ الْمَوْتَ وَهُوَ يَرَى مَنْ يَمُوتُ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who forgets death while he sees others dying [around him]

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِغَافِلٍ وَالْمَوْتُ حَثِيثٌ فِي طَلَبِهِ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who is negligent, while death is swift in seeking him

Wisdom: قَدْ ذَهَبَ عَنْ قُلُوبِكُمْ صِدْقُ الْأَجَلِ وَغَلَبَكُمْ غُرُورُ الْأَمَلِ
enWisdom: Your hearts have forgotten the reality of death and you have been overcome by deception of [false] hope

Wisdom: قَدْ غَابَ عَنْ قُلُوبِكُمْ ذِكْرُ الْآجَالِ وَحَضَرَتْكُمْ كَوَاذِبُ الْآمَالِ
enWisdom: The remembrance of [the times of] death has disappeared from your hearts and has been replaced by false hopes and aspirations

Wisdom: كَيْفَ تَنْسَى الْمَوْتَ وَآثَارُهُ تُذَكِّرُكَ
enWisdom: How can you forget death while its signs are [constantly] reminding you [of it]?

Wisdom: لَوْ فَكَّرْتُمْ فِي قُرْبِ الْأَجَلِ وَحُضُورِهِ لَأَمَرَّ عِنْدَكُمْ حُلْوُ الْعَيْشِ وَسُرُورُهُ
enWisdom: If you were to think about the closeness of death and its [imminent] arrival, the sweetness of life and its comfort would become bitter for you

Wisdom: لَوْ رَأَيْتُمُ الْأَجَلَ وَمَسِيرَهُ لَأَبْغَضْتُمُ الْأَمَلَ وَغُرُورَهُ
enWisdom: If you were to see death and its approach, you would surely hate [false] aspiration and its deception

Wisdom: مَنْ رَاقَبَ أَجَلَهُ قَصَّرَ أَمَلَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is mindful of his [eventual] death reduces his aspirations

Wisdom: مَنْ رَاقَبَ أَجَلَهُ اغْتَنَمَ مَهَلَهُ
enWisdom: The one who takes death into consideration values his time

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَقْصَرَ بَقَاءَهُ وَأَجَلَهُ قَصُرَ رَجَاؤُهُ وَأَمَلُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever regards his remaining lifetime to be fleeting, his hopes and aspirations become short
